headline: Amazon, Union Pacific, Whirlpool: Trending tickers
summary: Market Domination Host Josh Lipton and RBC Capital Markets head of derivatives strategy Amy Wu Silverman discuss some stocks that are in the news on Tuesday, July 29. Amazon (AMZN) received a price target boost, with Stifel analyst Mark Kelley raising his target for the stock to $262 from $245. Union Pacific (UNP) will buy Norfolk Southern (NSC) in an $85 billion stock and cash deal. Whirlpool (WHR) shares are being pummeled after posting disappointing Q2 results and cutting its full-year profit guidance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Union Pacific to buy Norfolk in $85 billion mega US railroad deal
summary: STORY: Union Pacific Railroad announced on Tuesday that it reached a deal to buy smaller rival Norfolk Southern for $85 billion.If approved, the deal would be the largest-ever buyout in the U.S. railroad industry.It would combine Union Pacific's stronghold in the west with Norfolk's almost 20,000-mile network in the east to create the first coast-to-coast freight rail operator in the country.But the nation's largest rail union released a statement Tuesday saying it plans to oppose the deal.The mega merger will face lengthy regulatory scrutiny amid union concerns over potential rate increases, service disruptions and job losses.The two railroads said the deal would result in a combined enterprise value of $250 billion and would unlock about $2.75 billion in annualized synergies.The deal also reflects a shift in antitrust enforcement under U.S. President Donald Trump's administration.Executive orders aimed at removing barriers to consolidation have opened the door to mergers that were previously considered unlikely.

content.title: Union Pacific to buy Norfolk in $85 billion mega US railroad deal
content.description:
STORY: Union Pacific Railroad announced on Tuesday that it reached a deal to buy smaller rival Norfolk Southern for $85 billion.

If approved, the deal would be the largest-ever buyout in the U.S. railroad industry.

It would combine Union Pacific's stronghold in the west with Norfolk's almost 20,000-mile network in the east to create the first coast-to-coast freight rail operator in the country.

But the nation's largest rail union released a statement Tuesday saying it plans to oppose the deal.

The mega merger will face lengthy regulatory scrutiny amid union concerns over potential rate increases, service disruptions and job losses.

The two railroads said the deal would result in a combined enterprise value of $250 billion and would unlock about $2.75 billion in annualized synergies.

The deal also reflects a shift in antitrust enforcement under U.S. President Donald Trump's administration.

Executive orders aimed at removing barriers to consolidation have opened the door to mergers that were previously considered unlikely.
content.summary: STORY: Union Pacific Railroad announced on Tuesday that it reached a deal to buy smaller rival Norfolk Southern for $85 billion.If approved, the deal would be the largest-ever buyout in the U.S. railroad industry.It would combine Union Pacific's stronghold in the west with Norfolk's almost 20,000-mile network in the east to create the first coast-to-coast freight rail operator in the country.But the nation's largest rail union released a statement Tuesday saying it plans to oppose the deal.The mega merger will face lengthy regulatory scrutiny amid union concerns over potential rate increases, service disruptions and job losses.The two railroads said the deal would result in a combined enterprise value of $250 billion and would unlock about $2.75 billion in annualized synergies.The deal also reflects a shift in antitrust enforcement under U.S. President Donald Trump's administration.Executive orders aimed at removing barriers to consolidation have opened the door to mergers that were previously considered unlikely.

headline: Union Pacific To Acquire Norfolk Southern (NSC) For US$71 Billion In Rail Mega-Merger
summary: Norfolk Southern (NSC) saw its stock price increase by 28% over the last quarter, driven by significant corporate developments. Key among these was the announcement of its acquisition by Union Pacific at a valuation of $71.4 billion, a landmark move in the rail industry. The company's robust Q2 earnings, with net income rising to $768 million, complemented the merger news, reinforcing investor confidence. In contrast to the broader market's more modest rise of 1.5% over the past seven days,...

headline: Explainer-Union Pacific deal to buy US rail rival faces lengthy review
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Union Pacific's proposed purchase of smaller rival rail operator Norfolk Southern will need to be approved by the Surface Transportation Board in Washington, an independent federal agency that oversees competition and other areas of importance in the rail industry.  What is the Surface Transportation Board?  It replaced the Interstate Commerce Commission, which was established in 1887.

content.title: Explainer-Union Pacific deal to buy US rail rival faces lengthy review
content.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Union Pacific's proposed purchase of smaller rival rail operator Norfolk Southern will need to be approved by the Surface Transportation Board in Washington, an independent federal agency that oversees competition and other areas of importance in the rail industry.  What is the Surface Transportation Board?  It replaced the Interstate Commerce Commission, which was established in 1887.
